meanings.definition: To impregnate or treat with resin.
meanings.sent1: I will resinate the wood to protect it from water damage.
meanings.sent2: The craftsman decided to resinate the table for a glossy finish.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy painter accidentally resinated his own hands together.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to resinate through the entire room.
meanings.sent5: The sweet smell of resin resinated in the air, creating a calming atmosphere.

meanings.sent1: Over time, the wood will resinate and develop a shiny surface.
meanings.sent2: The tree sap will slowly resinate and harden into amber.
meanings.sent3: The candy became so sticky that it started to resinate on my fingers.
meanings.sent4: The music seemed to resinate in his soul, filling him with joy.
meanings.sent5: The scent of pine trees resinated in the forest, creating a natural perfume.
